title: U.S., China Jointly Pledge to Step Up Efforts to Fight Climate Change at COP26
sub_head: Draft climate deal seeks quicker emissions cuts as weekend deadline nears
body:
GLASGOW—The U.S. and China jointly pledged at the United Nations climate summit to step up actions to fight climate change in the coming decade, injecting talks here with a surprise show of cooperation between the two rivals and the world’s two biggest greenhouse-gas emitters.
But the two didn’t endorse a proposal by the U.K., the host of the summit, for countries to update their emissions-cutting plans by the end of next year. That proposal, which was floated earlier in the day, was seen as a way of bridging the divide between what governments have committed to cutting and what scientists think is needed to avoid the worst effects of climate change.
